page.title: 10Transport
page.content: In common with many others in Devon, the people of the area rely heavily on the motor car for getting to work, school, shopping, or for visiting. Secondary school pupils attending Queen Elizabeth School in Crediton do have free transport provided by the County Council and Mid Devon Buses, but the bus taking primary school pupils to Lapford was withdrawn as an economy measure in July 1985, leaving them in the same unfortunate situation as those attending Bow School. This has led to an increase in traffic in the lanes, it being unrealistic to expect children to walk the three miles along them twice daily. Bow Belle Buses provide a service into Exeter, via Crediton, once a week on Fridays and, although not heavily used, is essential to those with no other means of transport.
